intro: Picramnia dolichobotrya, commonly known as the long-stalked picramnia, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
